Progression.TitleScreen:
THIS GAME IS NOT FINISHED!
-The story will end about 2/3 of the way through. -There are some rough edges that I still need to fix. -The game might crash randomly. Thanks for understanding. :)
(Temporary) Music Ambiment by Kevin MacLeod Link: https://incompetech.filmmusic.io/song/3359-ambiment License: https://filmmusic.io/standard-license
Act I My life as a tightrope walker, suspended above sense, wondering what was wrong with all the people on the ground.
Act II "And then a Plank in Reason, broke And I dropped down, and down - And hit a World, at every plunge, And Finished knowing - then -"
Act III Dr. Apodochi - or - How I learned to control the worrying and love my mom.

Prompt.TransitionText: Junior year, start of spring semester
Prompt.Text: I heard on the news that scientists are discovering black holes inside our galaxy.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Some of them are actually really close to Earth. They have no idea why they are just now finding them.

Triggers.Trigger: Wow, that's really interesting.
Wow, that's really freaky.
Scary, maybe Earth will get sucked in some day

Prompt.Text: I don't think you need to add that to your list of worries.
So, how are you doing?

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, it's probably nothing anyway.

Prompt.Text: That's great. I'm glad to hear that. How did the interview go?

Triggers.Trigger: I am just fine.
I feel just fine.
I am great!
I feel great!

Prompt.Text: Yeah, you never know. How about the TA job? How's that going?

Fragment.Text: I worked on it all night last night.

Triggers.Trigger: I think it went ok but we'll see.
I think it went well but we'll see.

Prompt.Text: That's not good. You need to sleep.

Fragment.Text: I just had a lot of energy.

Triggers.Trigger: It's fine, I worked on it all night last night.

Prompt.Text: I just hope you're not stressing yourself out too much. You've got a lot on your plate.

Triggers.Trigger: You're right... I'll do better tonight.
You're right... I just had a lot of energy.
It's fine, it's pretty easy stuff.

Prompt.Text: Alright, have a good day. Love you.

Triggers.Trigger: Everything is fine. I have class soon, talk to you later.

Prompt.Text: So how is grading the first assignment going?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Wow halfway? It's only been a day. How did you manage that?

Fragment.Text: had a lot of time yesterday.

Triggers.Trigger: It's going well I'm about halfway done.

Prompt.Text: Okay, well, just make sure you're taking care of your other classes before this job. You're a good student, I don't want to change that.

Triggers.Trigger: Well, I had a lot of time yesterday.
Well, I stayed up late last night.

Prompt.Text: How is Database Systems going? Who's teaching it this semester?

Triggers.Trigger: Thanks, I will.

Prompt.Text: Well, let me know when you find out. A student said you had trouble during lab yesterday. What happened there?

Triggers.Trigger: I forget their name, but they seem cool.

Prompt.Text: I figured. Most TA's struggle with that. It comes back to you.

Triggers.Trigger: It's been a few years since I took this class so I need to review.
Good to hear.
I'm sure it does.

Prompt.Text: While we're on the subject of helping students, I wanted to let you know what my teaching philosophy is.

Triggers.Trigger: Great, I'm interested to hear it.

Prompt.Text: Have you ever heard of the Pygmalion effect?

Triggers.Trigger: I have no idea, what is it?
Sounds familiar, but what is it?

Prompt.Text: Essentially, it's the idea that if you have higher expectations for someone, they will actually be able to perform better than if you expect less of them.

Triggers.Trigger: Well, that explains some of the assignments we had.

Prompt.Text: Haha, it's true I make it tough, but you made it through didn't you? I think students learn more when they are challenged.

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, I totally agree.

Prompt.Text: There are limits to it though, you can't just believe in someone hard enough that they can become a surgeon.

Triggers.Trigger: Makes sense.

Prompt.Text: So when you're helping a student, just keep that in mind. Don't lower your expectations for someone unless they give you a really good reason to. Do you have any questions about class?
Well, we're just digging deeper into C++ next lecture. So study up on polymorphism.

Triggers.Trigger: What's coming up next?

Prompt.Text: Yes, but also multi-inheritence, object slicing, and the memory model behind it all.

Triggers.Trigger: Great, so just inheritance right?

Prompt.Text: What's on your plate now? Do you have time to do the next assignment before class next week?

Triggers.Trigger: Oh right, I remember.

Prompt.Text: Good. No rush. I'll see you next week. Have a nice weekend.

Triggers.Trigger: Of course! I can get that done tomorrow.

Prompt.Text: Hey what's up? It's almost midnight here.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: What? What's wrong?

Triggers.Trigger: Mom, I am losing it.

Prompt.Text: That's not important right now. Breathe. Just Breathe right now.

Triggers.Trigger: I can't write this paper. It's due tonight.
I can't write this paper.

Prompt.Text: You need to worry about this in the morning, and go to bed right now.

Triggers.Trigger: Okay... Alright... Breathing...

Prompt.Text: I know, but your body needs sleep whether it's telling you that or not.

Triggers.Trigger: You're right... I'm just really not tired lately.

Prompt.Text: How far are you?

Triggers.Trigger: This paper is due in a few hours. I just need to finish it.

Prompt.Text: That's it? How long have you been working on it?

Triggers.Trigger: "The central ludic metaphor in Case's WBWWB is...

Prompt.Text: What's keeping you from writing?

Triggers.Trigger: I dunno maybe an hour?

Prompt.Text: Do you think it's anxiety related?

Triggers.Trigger: I can't keep my thoughts straight.
I can't keep my head straight.
I can't get my thoughts straight.
I can't get my head straight.

Prompt.Text: If I made you an appointment, would you see a therapist again?

Triggers.Trigger: Maybe... I have been stressed out lately.

Prompt.Text: I actually got an email from your university. They offer free counseling.

Triggers.Trigger: I don't think I need to. It just sounds like an expensive hassle.

Prompt.Text: What? No! What are you talking about?

Triggers.Trigger: Who sent that? Are they really monitoring me?

Prompt.Text: What do you mean "glitches"?

Triggers.Trigger: I have been noticing things... people staring, strange ads, "glitches."

Prompt.Text: OK, I don't know what that means, but you're freaking me out.

Triggers.Trigger: My VPN randomly disconnected yesterday it never does that.

Prompt.Text: No, not that. You sound crazy right now.

Triggers.Trigger: It freaks me out too! I'm not sure who it is yet, but...

Prompt.Text: I know it happened, but it sounds like you're coming up with conspiracy theories.

Triggers.Trigger: I'm not crazy, that actually happened.

Prompt.Text: Great! It'll do it. We should also schedule a doctor's appointment?

Triggers.Trigger: Oh Really? That sounds good, I could do that.

Prompt.Text: It's going to take some time to get you in with the therapist, but I can make a doctor's appointment soon.

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, sounds good, thanks.
Really? Maybe you're right.

Prompt.Text: What brings you in today?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Okay. Very common problem for students. Can you describe it?

Triggers.Trigger: Anxiety.

Prompt.Text: Hm. And how often does this happen?

Triggers.Trigger: Sure, my thoughts race, and I feel like something terrible is about to happen.

Prompt.Text: How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?

Triggers.Trigger: Hard to say. Maybe a few times a day?
Well, it comes and goes but this semester has been especially bad.

Prompt.Text: What do you mean by "It comes and goes?"

Triggers.Trigger: I had a similar period in High School.

Prompt.Text: How did you deal with it then?

Triggers.Trigger: Well, I started therapy, which helped, and I tried antidepressants.

Prompt.Text: You "tried" antidepressants? Did they help?

Triggers.Trigger: I don't think so, actually. Things got worse after starting them, so we stopped.

Prompt.Text: How is the anxiety affecting your life?

Triggers.Trigger: I'm having trouble keeping up with school.

Prompt.Text: It's definitely concerning. I would recommend you seek therapy. There are great resources here for that.

Triggers.Trigger: I have an appointment, but it's a ways off.

Prompt.Text: Great. I know you had a bad experience in the past, but I would also like to prescribe you an antidepressant.

Triggers.Trigger: Are you sure? Why would it work now?

Prompt.Text: The main difference is that now you're older, children and adults respond differently to this type of medicine. We can stop it at any time.

Triggers.Trigger: I guess I am open to that.

Prompt.Text: Good. I'm going to give you my cell number. Call me if your symptoms get worse. Otherwise, I would like to see you in a month to see your progress. Sound good?
Hey how's it going?

Triggers.Trigger: START
I feel like things just keep getting worse.

Prompt.Text: What's going on?

Triggers.Trigger: I keep missing deadlines, and I can't even boot up a computer without freaking out.

Prompt.Text: I think we need to do something about this. It's been going on too long.

Triggers.Trigger: I think once I see the therapist, things will improve.

Prompt.Text: Hopefully. Did you at least sleep well last night?

Triggers.Trigger: Yes.

Prompt.Text: Really?

Triggers.Trigger: Not really.
No.

Prompt.Text: I think if you would just get a good nights sleep, you would feel better.

Triggers.Trigger: I am trying. No caffeine, no alcohol, no screens after 8. I'm meditating, taking baths, and not working, but I end up just lying there for hours.

Prompt.Text: I know. We just need to get you sleeping. Is the anxiety what's keeping you up?

Triggers.Trigger: Well, not exactly my mind just races.

Prompt.Text: What has been on your mind?

Triggers.Trigger: Lots of things. Homework I have, grading assignments, major life events.

Prompt.Text: Major life events?

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, like how do the events of my childhood impact my personality.

Prompt.Text: Don't you think, if you have too much going on in your head, maybe you should dial back your responsibilities?

Triggers.Trigger: I feel like I've already cut everything I can.

Prompt.Text: Well. What I mean is... Do you really need to be a TA right now?

Triggers.Trigger: I can't just quit right now. I just started, and I don't want to let down the professor or the other TAs.

Prompt.Text: I think they would understand if you told them what's going on.

Triggers.Trigger: No, I can't.

Prompt.Text: You have to realize that this isn't a good thing for you. You're falling behind, not sleeping, having bad anxiety. You're being pulled apart from every conceivable direction. You need to do something.

Triggers.Trigger: But what if I can just ride out this storm, and get better?

Prompt.Text: If it was going to get better on its own. Why hasn't it improved in the last month?

Triggers.Trigger: I don't think this studio will take me on as an intern if they find out that I quit.

Prompt.Text: Maybe not, but your health is more important to me than an internship, and it should be to you too.

Triggers.Trigger: I just - No... You're right. I'll quit.

Prompt.Text: You're making the right decision... Let me know how it goes.
Hey, sorry I can't talk long. I have to finish something here before noon.

Triggers.Trigger: START
Okay, this shouldn't take long.

Prompt.Text: What's wrong? You seem upset.

Triggers.Trigger: I think I... need to quit.

Prompt.Text: I thought you might. I heard from someone else what's been going on.

Triggers.Trigger: Which professor? Is it that obvious?

Prompt.Text: Not one of your professors, someone else in this department mentioned that you opened up to them about being stressed out. It's okay, I understand.

Triggers.Trigger: So everyone knows?

Prompt.Text: No! They just told me because you work with me. Nobody is gossiping about this. We're concerned for you.

Triggers.Trigger: Okay. So what happens now?

Prompt.Text: Well, I can tell the other TAs. I'll just tell them you had a personal conflict. And I want you to make sure you are paid. So you'll need to talk to accounting.

Triggers.Trigger: And what will you tell the students?

Prompt.Text: Nothing at all. They don't need to know anything.

Triggers.Trigger: Oh yeah, right.

Prompt.Text: Before you go, I want to know if there is anything I could have done better to make this job easier for you?

Triggers.Trigger: Well, I feel your expectations are a bit high.

Prompt.Text: What? Really?

Triggers.Trigger: No. What I meant was-

Prompt.Text: Don't worry about it. Just- I hope you start to feel better. Good luck.
Hello?

Triggers.Trigger: START
I need help.

Prompt.Text: Who is this?

Triggers.Trigger: I saw you a few weeks ago. I don't know what to do.

Prompt.Text: What's going on, is it an emergency?

Triggers.Trigger: Yes. It's anxiety again, but its worse.
No. It's anxiety again, but its worse.
Maybe? It's anxiety again, but its worse.

Prompt.Text: How is it worse?

Triggers.Trigger: I feel like I might pass out. Everything is freaking me out. I can't move, but I can't stay still.

Prompt.Text: Are you in a safe place right now? Is there anyone there with you?

Triggers.Trigger: I'm home. My roommate's here, but I can't talk to him.

Prompt.Text: Why can't you talk to him?

Triggers.Trigger: He's busy... I don't want to bug him.

Prompt.Text: Do you feel like you want to hurt yourself or anyone else?

Triggers.Trigger: What no.

Prompt.Text: It sounds like you're having a panic attack. It will pass, but it might take some time.

Triggers.Trigger: How can I make it stop?

Prompt.Text: Focus on your breathing, try to slow down, and talking to someone helps.

Triggers.Trigger: What if this happens again?

Prompt.Text: Therapy can help prevent events like this. If you want, I can prescribe you a stronger anxiety medication for acute episodes like this.

Triggers.Trigger: Okay, that sounds good.

Prompt.Text: I want you to make an appointment with me as soon as possible. If the anxiety gets worse, you should call the crisis hotline.
You need a ride to the pharmacy? At 1 am?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Okay... Yeah I can do that, no problem.

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, it's kinda urgent.

Prompt.Text: Does this have to do with the anxiety you've been dealing with?

Triggers.Trigger: Thanks, I really appreciate it.

Prompt.Text: Do you want to talk about it?

Triggers.Trigger: Kinda, yeah.

Prompt.Text: Okay. You know you can talk to me about anything, right?

Triggers.Trigger: Uh, not really?

Prompt.Text: Good morning! Feeling any better today?

Triggers.Trigger: START
I actually feel great.

Prompt.Text: Good! Glad to hear you're feeling better. What did you end up doing last night?

Triggers.Trigger: I watched some old kids movies, and read some of this book.

Prompt.Text: Wow. That's a lot for one night. Is it the book for your game development class?

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, it's super interesting.

Prompt.Text: What's it about again? I forgot.

Triggers.Trigger: Basically it's about how games can be designed to do interesting things like create a better way for socially anxious people to interact.

Prompt.Text: Very interesting! That'd be great for you!

Triggers.Trigger: Ha ha, very funny.
Ha ha, good one!

Prompt.Text: Just messing with you. So how could a game do that? Help people interact?

Triggers.Trigger: Well, imagine a game that uses earbuds and you hear "A lover is near." Then you hear "You have gained a life."

Prompt.Text: Alright...

Triggers.Trigger: A stranger in the same place as you is playing the game too, and they gave you a life!

Prompt.Text: Oh wow, that is pretty interesting.

Triggers.Trigger: Now imagine a game at a university...

Prompt.Text: Yeah?

Triggers.Trigger: Where teachers identify students in crisis and have their students try to plant ideas in their heads to get them to seek help.

Prompt.Text: That's a weird one... Was that from the book too?

Triggers.Trigger: Yup, last chapter i read.

Prompt.Text: Hm. That's really strange. I don't know if I like that one. Oh! There's more space news. Do you want to hear about it?

Triggers.Trigger: Sure, what is it?

Prompt.Text: Well, they keep finding black holes all throughout the universe.

Triggers.Trigger: Really? Are they trying a new detection method?

Prompt.Text: They didn't say so on the news. I think there must be some kind of event that's causing them to randomly appear.

Triggers.Trigger: Well that is absolutely terrifying.

Prompt.Text: I'm sorry sometimes I forget who I'm talking to. You really don't need to worry about this.

Triggers.Trigger: We will see I can never tell what is going to make me worry.

Prompt.Text: Hm. Yeah, well maybe you can talk to the therapist about that today.
Nice to see you in class for a change.

Triggers.Trigger: START
Figured I would try it out. See how it feels.

Prompt.Text: Did you do the reading?

Triggers.Trigger: I did. Did you?

Prompt.Text: Yeah, I thought it was really interesting. It made me think of games in a totally different way.

Triggers.Trigger: Totally agree. What's your idea for the assignment?

Prompt.Text: I was thinking about designing a game where you try to get a ball to a goal, but you have to play against the hands of a real clock that matches the current time. Like a brutalist kind of game. What about you?

Triggers.Trigger: I'm pulled towards a game idea that incentivizes people to help others.

Prompt.Text: Sounds promising, I'm hooked. How does it work?

Triggers.Trigger: Maybe it would be an app where players have a target.

Prompt.Text: A target? Like to assasinate?

Triggers.Trigger: No, the person they are trying to help.

Prompt.Text: What would the actual app do?

Triggers.Trigger: Give players objectives like talk to them, smile at them, track them, and so on.

Prompt.Text: Hm. Yeah. I feel like tracking them is a bit extreme, but it might work.

Triggers.Trigger: I'm curious if it has been done already.

Prompt.Text: Maybe, but it sounds like a pretty unique idea. I think you're good.

Triggers.Trigger: So you've never heard of anything like it?

Prompt.Text: Uh, no. Definitely not. I actually need to turn in this report before class starts so I'll talk to you later.
I see that you've been struggling with anxiety, and your doctor told me you had a panic attack. Tell me about that.

Triggers.Trigger: START
Okay but first, I have a question for you.

Prompt.Text: Okay sure, what is it?

Triggers.Trigger: Are you legally obligated to keep everything I say private?

Prompt.Text: Well, basically yes. The only thing that would change that is if I believed you were going to hurt yourself or someone else.
So, back to the anxiety. What's going on with that?

Triggers.Trigger: Okay good
Well, actually another question. This one is important.

Prompt.Text: Okay, sure, but after that let's start talking about you, alright?

Triggers.Trigger: Sure, sure so, I know. I know about the game.

Prompt.Text: The game?

Triggers.Trigger: The game you and the faculty are playing to try to help me.

Prompt.Text: I'm sorry I don't know what you're talking about.

Triggers.Trigger: Of course, are you just an actor or are you a real therapist?

Prompt.Text: Why would you think I'm an actor?

Triggers.Trigger: It's pretty obvious. The same "patient" walked past me like 10 times in the waiting room.

Prompt.Text: How does that mean I'm an actor?

Triggers.Trigger: She was obviously monitoring me!

Prompt.Text: Okay I see. I am really interested in this idea, but I want to start with some other questions if that's alright with you.

Triggers.Trigger: Alright, but can you just turn off the cameras first?

Prompt.Text: There are no cameras. I want to know when the last time you slept was.

Triggers.Trigger: Um, I'm not sure I've been up late a lot lately, but it's been a few days probably.

Prompt.Text: Why aren't you sleeping?

Triggers.Trigger: Well, I'm just figuring out the game. By the way, I love the idea. I just want it to stop.

Prompt.Text: Let me ask this again. Why aren't you sleeping?

Triggers.Trigger: I just answered that. Can't you see the effect this is having on me? Just make it stop!

Prompt.Text: I'm very concerned that you haven't been able to sleep, and I think sleeping would help you with the problems you're having.

Triggers.Trigger: Okay, you're right, but I've got a lot going on. I swear I've tried everything.

Prompt.Text: Well, I think you need to drop everything else right now and focus on getting some sleep. I would like to call my friend at the hospital and see if they can help you with that.

Triggers.Trigger: I don't want to miss school...

Prompt.Text: I really think you should consider it. Missing a little bit of school is not a big deal. It might not even take long. I just want to get you sleeping.

Triggers.Trigger: Okay, that sounds good.

Prompt.Text: Good. Let me make the call.

Triggers.Trigger: KILL

Prompt.Text: BLANK
CLEAR!

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: He's waking up!

Triggers.Trigger: Where am I

Prompt.Text: You just had a seizure, we're taking you to the hospital.

Triggers.Trigger: Who are you

Prompt.Text: Hey! Stay with me buddy!

Triggers.Trigger: What're these little pads on my chest?

Prompt.Text: Oh... You're awake. Welcome home.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: I'm hiding in the vents. You don't remember me? we've been friends for a long time... But forget all that - You have much more important things to think about now.

Triggers.Trigger: Who are you? I can't see you.

Prompt.Text: It's complicated... Basically you got sucked in, and there are many dangers associated with that. Everyone in here is out to get you.

Triggers.Trigger: What is this place?

Prompt.Text: Hard to say. Maybe they want to steal your identity, or make you some kind of slave. Look, I can tell you want to get out of here. So I can try to help you figure out how.

Triggers.Trigger: What will they do to me?

Prompt.Text: No time to chat, it looks like they're coming. Act cool.

Triggers.Trigger: Why would you want to help me?

Prompt.Text: Hi, we're going to be taking care of you. Do you remember where you are?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: You're in a psychiatric hospital. You had a seizure yesterday and last night you were transferred here. Don't worry, this is a safe place.

Triggers.Trigger: You look kinda familiar.

Prompt.Text: I'm not sure what you're talking about, you've been alone in here all night.
What's going on inside your head right now?

Triggers.Trigger: Who was I just talking to?

Prompt.Text: We're not sure what's going on, but we think it might be seratonin syndrome. That can happen when a person takes too many antidepressants. Have you been taking the right amount?

Triggers.Trigger: I feel like I'm thinking millions of thoughts at once.

Prompt.Text: Okay, we'll start there.
We're starting you on 50mg of anticonvulsant.
A strong dose of antipsychotics.
and another thing
also this too

Triggers.Trigger: natural sequence 2

Prompt.Text: How'd that go? Did you take the pills?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Doesn't matter much. Keep taking them so they don't catch on.

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, I did. Why?

Prompt.Text: Yeah probably, I think the nurse can give you a phone.

Triggers.Trigger: Okay. Can I call my mom now?

Prompt.Text: Do you know how to dial out on a phone like that?

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, I'll go do that.

Prompt.Text: Right, but sometimes you have to dial 9, then 1, then the phone number.

Triggers.Trigger: Some phones make you dial 9 first right?

Prompt.Text: Definitely. Make sure you actually use the country code too just in case.

Triggers.Trigger: Good point. Should I start with the area code?

Prompt.Text: Hi there. What do you need?

Triggers.Trigger: START
Can I make a phone call?

Prompt.Text: Sure, you can just use that phone right there.
Wait. Why is it ringing already... Did you just dial 911?

Triggers.Trigger: NONE

Prompt.Text: Wait. Why is it ringing already... Did you just dial 911?

Triggers.Trigger: NONE

Prompt.Text: You can't dial 911 from a hospital. That can get us in serious trouble.

Triggers.Trigger: NONE

Prompt.Text: That's strike one. I can't let you use the phone anymore. You need to go back to your room and get some rest.
Did you hear what that nurse just said?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Don't worry, you've got me. You don't need it.

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, they banned me from using the phone.

Prompt.Text: You can talk to her when you get out. And I think I found a way.

Triggers.Trigger: But I need to talk to my mom.

Prompt.Text: The nurse just said you got a strike right? Isn't the rule three strikes and you're out?

Triggers.Trigger: What is it?

Prompt.Text: We just need to figure out how to get two more strikes.

Triggers.Trigger: Oh yeah! Of course!

Prompt.Text: It's the only way out that I can see. Besides, they're out to get you. They might be plotting to kill your family right now.

Triggers.Trigger: Well I don't want to bother anyone.

Prompt.Text: "Why" doesn't matter. It's happening. You know how they took your phone and backpack when you got here?

Triggers.Trigger: Why would they do that?

Prompt.Text: Where do you think your phone and laptop are now? How easy would it be to find out your secrets?

Triggers.Trigger: I don't really remember that, but...

Prompt.Text: You see that girl drawing a beached whale over there?

Triggers.Trigger: They would need the password though.

Prompt.Text: Didn't you write a poem about being a beached whale? Isn't it on your computer somewhere.

Triggers.Trigger: Yeah, so what?

Prompt.Text: Look, this is bad. They have everything. They have your contacts. They know where your family lives.

Triggers.Trigger: Oh god how did they get in?

Prompt.Text: So we're on the same page. Back to the strikes.

Triggers.Trigger: We need to get out. Now.

Prompt.Text: Well. We could pull the fire alarm. There's got to be a fire alarm somewhere. That would get us another strike. We can regroup after that and think of more ways.

Triggers.Trigger: What can we do?

Prompt.Text: That's it. That's like, six strikes, what the hell is wrong with you? Get him into the isolation room.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Get in there!

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Hey! Can you hear me?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: I'm out here outside the window! I got out!

Triggers.Trigger: What? Where are you?

Prompt.Text: Don't worry. I'll get you out.

Triggers.Trigger: I can't see you. The window is like frosted glass.

Prompt.Text: Did they put you in the box?

Triggers.Trigger: Is it cold out there? It's cold in here.

Prompt.Text: It's going to be harder to get out then. Do you see the writing on the wall?

Triggers.Trigger: Uh, yeah... I guess.

Prompt.Text: What does it say?

Triggers.Trigger: Huh? No - wait yeah I do.

Prompt.Text: You know who wrote that?

Triggers.Trigger: It's my name and a list of people I know.

Prompt.Text: Figure out how to get out. I'll try to think of another way.

Triggers.Trigger: It would have to be one of them.

Prompt.Text: Kid, you need to stop banging on the door. You're going to hurt yourself.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: We can't let you out, it's for the safety of the other patients.

Triggers.Trigger: LET ME OUT.

Prompt.Text: I don't think you do know what's going on. You had a psychotic break. We're treating you for bipolar disorder.

Triggers.Trigger: LOOK ASSHOLE I KNOW WHAT IS GOING ON YOU CAN'T GET AWAY WITH THIS.

Prompt.Text: Okay. He's going to get hurt. Sedate him.

Triggers.Trigger: FUCK OFF ALRIGHT GET ME OUT.

Prompt.Text: Are you awake in there?

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Oh shit that's not good. I figured out a way to get you out okay.

Triggers.Trigger: Where am I?

Prompt.Text: Get away from the window okay? I'll count down.

Triggers.Trigger: How long was I out for?
What are you doing?

Prompt.Text: Oh man, this window is like bullet-proof!

Triggers.Trigger: Holy shit what are you doing?

Prompt.Text: Damnit I'm such an idiot I'm so sorry man, I'll figure something out.

Triggers.Trigger: You're scaring me. Go away.

Prompt.Text: Hey kid, I need you to come with me.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: This way, come on.

Triggers.Trigger: You're letting me out?

Prompt.Text: You have a visitor.

Triggers.Trigger: Look, I'm sorry for yelling just please let me go.

Prompt.TransitionText: And all of a sudden, the pieces begin to assemble
Prompt.Text: Hey...

Triggers.Trigger: START
Mom?

Prompt.Text: Son, you're having a psychotic break. I flew in last night and talked to the doctors.

Triggers.Trigger: Are you okay? Is everyone okay?

Prompt.Text: We're all fine. You will be, too.

Triggers.Trigger: Can you get me out of here?

Prompt.Text: The doctors say you haven't been making much progress. We need to fix your brain before you can leave.

Triggers.Trigger: How do we fix it?

Prompt.Text: I don't know. We need to figure out what's wrong first. The doctors don't know yet...

Triggers.Trigger: I feel better right now mom, honestly.

Prompt.Text: I believe you. We can stick it out here. Come here. I really need a hug.
Hi there. Welcome to my game. I have a few houskeeping notes before we begin. First, once you finish reading dialogue. Press 'A' on a gamepad or 'SPACEBAR' on a keyboard.
To move up and down, the controls will be 'W' and 'S' on the keyboard, or the left joystick of a controller.
Let's give that a go.

Triggers.Trigger: START

Prompt.Text: Nice. That's pretty much all you need to know to get through.
But - there is something else I want you to know before you play this.
This is a game about a mental health crisis. It features some things that may be uncomfortable.
I want to share this story with you, but I also need you to understand that it may not be easy to play if you're in a vulnerable state.

Triggers.Trigger: Press 'W' and 'S' to catch thoughts.

Prompt.Text: Last thing, then I'm out of your hair for a while.
While this game is based in truth. I took many liberties with the way the story is presented.
The characters are not meant to represent real people. They are different forces in my life personified.
There are periods of this story that I don't remember well, and I have to rely on my what I've been told and the small things that I do remember.
Events are selectively stretched out and condensed for the sake of pace.
I don't blame anyone for anything that happened to me. This was a tough situation for everyone involved.
Enjoy the game.

Triggers.Trigger: Got it. Understood.
